it.polimi.se2019.server.games.board

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.util.Observable<Response>
      • it.polimi.se2019.server.games.board.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Board
extends Observable<Response>
    Objects of this class represents the board of a game, they're composed by tiles. Most of the method of this class are run by the controller to check condition for the action requested by the player.
    Author:
    Rodolfo Mariotti
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Create an empty board object. This constructor should only be used in tests.

      • Board

        public Board(java.lang.String id,
             Tile[][] tileMap)
        Create a complete board object. This constructor sets the id and the tileMap of the new object.
        Parameters:
        id - unique identifier of the board
        tileMap - tiles of the board

    • Method Detail

      • getTileMap

        public Tile[][] getTileMap()
        Getter method for the tileMap attribute.
        Returns:
        tiles of the map as a bi-dimensional array

        Returns:
        tiles of the maps as a list

        public void setTileMap(Tile[][] tileMap)
        Setter method for the tileMap attribute.
        Parameters:
        tileMap - reference to the array to set as tileMap

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(int xCoord,
                    int yCoord)
        This method is used to retrieve a tile in a selected position.
        Parameters:
        xCoord - x coordinate of the tile
        yCoord - y coordinate of the tile
        Returns:
        the tile at position (x, y) in the board

      • getTileFromID

        public Tile getTileFromID(java.lang.String id)
        This method is used to retrieve a tile of the board with a given id.
        Parameters:
        id - id of the tile to retrieve
        Returns:
        the requested tile or null if no tile in board matches

      • getTilePosition

        public int[] getTilePosition(Tile tile)
                      throws TileNotFoundException
        Gets the position of a tile in board from a reference of a tile.
        Parameters:
        tile - reference of a tile
        Returns:
        an array of two values containing the x coordinate and the y coordinate of the tile [x, y]
        Throws:
        TileNotFoundException - if the tile is not in this board

      • generateGraph

        public Graph<Tile> generateGraph()
        Generate a graph of the board from the tile map. The graph is used by other methods to calculate the distance between two tiles.
        Returns:
        graph of the board

      • getSpawnTile

        public Tile getSpawnTile(RoomColor roomColor)
        This method gets the spawn tile for the specified color. Since there is one room for each color and each room has only one spawn tile, this tile is unique.
        Parameters:
        roomColor - color of the room
        Returns:
        spawn tile of the room selected

      • getTileTree

        public Graph<Tile> getTileTree()
        Getter method for the tileTree. The tile tree is used to calculate the distance between two tiles.
        Returns:
        th tree representation of the board

      • setTileTree

        public void setTileTree(Graph<Tile> tileTree)
        Getter method
        Parameters:
        tileTree -

      • getDirection

        public Direction getDirection(Tile firstTile,
                              Tile secondTile)
        Gets the relative position between two tiles. Diagonal cases are not handled and will throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        firstTile - starting tile
        secondTile - arrival tile
        Returns:
        direction between the two tiles
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - the selected tiles are not on the same row or column

      • isOneDirectionList

        public boolean isOneDirectionList(Direction dir,
                                  Tile tile,
                                  java.util.List<Tile> tileList)
        This method is used to check if the tiles in the tile list passed are all in the specified direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - direction to check
        tile - starting tile
        tileList - other tiles
        Returns:
        true if all the tiles are in the specified direction false otherwise

      • getTilesAtDistance

        public java.util.List<Tile> getTilesAtDistance(Tile baseTile,
                                               java.lang.Integer distance)
        Get all the tiles with the same specified distance from a specified tile.
        Parameters:
        baseTile - central point
        distance - radius
        Returns:
        tiles equidistant (at distance specified by distance param) from the baseTile

      • getPlayersAtDistance

        public java.util.List<Player> getPlayersAtDistance(Game game,
                                                   Tile baseTile,
                                                   java.lang.Integer distance)
        Get all the players whit the same specified distance from a specified tile.
        Parameters:
        game - the game that contains the board and the players
        baseTile - central point
        distance - radius
        Returns:
        players equidistant (at distance specified by distance param) from the baseTile

      • setAmmoCrate

        public void setAmmoCrate(int xPosition,
                         int yPosition,
                         AmmoCrate ammoCrate)
        Given a position (x, y) and an ammo crate sets the ammo crate of the tile in position (x, y) to te value passed as param.
        Parameters:
        xPosition - x coordinate of the tile
        yPosition - y coordinate of the tile
        ammoCrate - ammo crate to set in (x, y)
